thread.title: Martin set to miss Wildcats opener
thread.title_full: Martin set to miss Wildcats opener

title: Martin set to miss Wildcats opener
text:
Damian Martin set to miss Perth Wildcats NBL opener in Adelaide Chris Robinson PerthNow Damian Martin set to miss Perth Wildcats NBL opener in Adelaide Chris Robinson PerthNow New Zealand Breakers broken by Adelaide 36ers 1:42 
NBL: The Adelaide 36ers get the perfect start to the 2015/16 season, thrashing the New Zealand Breakers by 19 points at Titanium Security Arena in South Australia October 7th 2015 a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/ 
WILDCATS skipper Damian Martin looks set to miss his team’s season opener in Adelaide on Saturday night as he continues to overcome a calf injury. 
Martin did a series of fitness tests at practice on Thursday morning away from the main group, continuing a light week on the training court following the pre-season injury. 
Gleeson said Martin would fly with the team to South Australia on Friday morning but was unlikely to be risked. 
“He’ll struggle,” Gleeson said. 
“We’ll obviously put him through a fitness test (on Friday) but he’s going to have to tick a few boxes. But he’d be doubtful at the moment. 
“He’s our captain and we always want him out there, but we’ve got to make sure he can play the whole season and we’re not forcing it.” Other Stories
